Package de.bcxp.challenge.documentParsing.csv

Class WeatherCsvParser

java.lang.Object
de.bcxp.challenge.documentParsing.csv.CsvParser<WeatherEntry>
de.bcxp.challenge.documentParsing.csv.WeatherCsvParser
All Implemented Interfaces:
IDocumentParser<WeatherEntry>
public class WeatherCsvParser extends CsvParser<WeatherEntry>
A CSV parser specifically for weather data entries.

WeatherCsvParser extends CsvParser to parse CSV files containing daily weather information. Each record is expected to contain fields such as day, maximum temperature, and minimum temperature, which are mapped to WeatherEntry objects.

This parser assumes that the CSV file includes a header row, and uses a configurable delimiter.

  • Method Details

    • parseDocument

      public List<WeatherEntry> parseDocument(String filepath) throws IOException, NumberFormatException, ParseException
      Parses a List of WeatherEntry from the specified file path.

      Reads a CSV file with headers and converts each record into a WeatherEntry. The expected headers include values for name, maximum temperature, and minimum temperature.

      Parameters:
      filepath - the String path to the CSV document resource
      Returns:
      a List of WeatherEntry objects representing the parsed content
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while accessing or reading the file
      NumberFormatException - if a numeric field (e.g., temperature) cannot be parsed as a double
      ParseException - if a parsing-related error occurs (e.g., malformed or missing fields)
